net.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: something used for catching fish, insects, or animals which is made of threads or wires woven across each other with regular spaces between them
net.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the thing that players must hit the ball over in games such as tennis
net.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: the thing behind the posts that players try to kick or hit the ball into in games such as football or hockey
net.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Henry kicked the ball into the back of the net.
net.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: something used for keeping things out, for example insects or birds, which is made of threads woven across each other with regular spaces between them
net.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: very thin material made from fine threads woven together, with small spaces between
net.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the net amount is the final amount that remains after all the other amounts have been taken away
net.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The net profit  (=after taxes, costs etc) was up 16.3% last month.
The company reported a net loss of $56 million last year.
Vernon estimates the company’s net worth at over $8 billion.
The United States is a net importer of beef  (=it imports more than it exports).
net.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to earn a particular amount of money as a profit after tax has been paid
net.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: I was netting around $64,000 a year.
net.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: to succeed in getting something, especially by using your skill
net.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: The company has recently netted several large contracts.
An undercover sweep netted 22 suspects in one evening.
net.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: to hit or kick the ball into the net in sport
net.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: Rooney has netted nine goals for United so far this season.
net.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: to catch a fish in a net
net.translation[2].definitions[3].exampl: We netted three fish in under an hour.
net.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: a net amount of money is one that remains after things such as costs and tax have been taken away
net.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Net income after higher taxes, provisions and depreciation jumped more than 25%.
The company reported a net loss for the period after a charge related to reorganization costs.
The payment is net of tax.
net.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: in buying, exporting etc, concerning a situation where the amount bought etc by one side is more than the amount bought etc by the other
net.translation[3].definitions[1].exampl: Because of its oil fields in the North Sea, Britain is a net exporter (=a country that exports more than it imports) of oil, though a small one.

Canadian investors were net purchasers of US equities for the third straight quarter  (=the value of US shares bought by Canadians was more than the value of Canadian shares bought by people in the US).
net.translation[3].definitions[2].defini: the net weight of something is its weight without its container or wrapping
net.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: the system that allows computer users all over the world to communicate with each other; the Internet
net.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: Most users do not aimlessly surf the net (=look at information in different places as a form of entertainment). They always or usually go back to the same sites.
net.translation[4].definitions[1].defini: a company’s profit after tax has been taken away
net.translation[4].definitions[1].exampl: The supermarket chain said net for the quarter was $40.3 million.
net.translation[4].definitions[2].defini: a system that will prevent people from suffering financial problems if they become ill, unemployed etc
net.translation[4].definitions[2].exampl: safety net programs, including unemployment compensation and retraining of workers
The social welfare net is essential.
net.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: if something nets a company or a person a particular amount of money, it gives them that amount, perhaps after costs are taken away
net.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: Its public stock offering netted the company $72 million.
charges involving a fraud scheme that netted him $12 million
net.translation[5].definitions[1].defini: if a person or a company nets a certain amount in a year, they earn that amount as income or as profit after tax is taken away
net.translation[5].definitions[1].exampl: The farm netted as much as $1.5 million a year.
After the capital-gains tax was paid, we only netted about $3.25 per hour.
net.translation[6].definitions[0].defini: after things such as costs and tax have been taken away
net.translation[6].definitions[0].exampl: someone who earns more than £40,000 net
All fund dividends are paid gross rather than net of tax.
